American Confidence in Elections: District of Columbia Election Fraud Prevention Act
To amend the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to prohibit collection and transmission of ballots by certain third parties in District of Columbia elections, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary:
American Confidence in Elections: District of Columbia Election Fraud Prevention Act
This bill prohibits the collection and transmission of a ballot for a District of Columbia election by a person other than the person to whom it was mailed, with limited exceptions.
Exceptions exist for (1) election officials performing their official duties; (2) U.S. Postal Service employees and other individuals engaged in official duties to collect or transmit U.S. mail; and (3) a family member, household member, or caregiver of the person to whom the ballot was mailed.
